sub_topic: Solving systems of linear equations using QR decomposition
message_1:
Find the solution using QR decomposition for the system of linear equations:

3x + 2y - z = 1

x - y + 4z = -7

2x + y - 3z = 4
message_2:
To solve the system of linear equations using QR decomposition, we first need to represent the system in the matrix form Ax = b, where A is the matrix of coefficients, x is the column vector of variables, and b is the column vector of constants.

A = | 3  2 -1 |
    | 1 -1  4 |
    | 2  1 -3 |

b = |  1 |
    | -7 |
    |  4 |

Now, we perform QR decomposition on matrix A, where Q is an orthogonal matrix and R is an upper triangular matrix.

Using the Gram-Schmidt process, we can find the QR decomposition of A:

1. Find the orthonormal basis for A:

u1 = a1 = (3, 1, 2)
e1 = u1 / ||u1|| = (3, 1, 2) / sqrt(14) = (3/sqrt(14), 1/sqrt(14), 2/sqrt(14))

u2 = a2 - (a2·e1)e1 = (2, -1, 1) - (8/14)(3, 1, 2) = (-1/7, -9/7, 4/7)
e2 = u2 / ||u2|| = (-1/7, -9/7, 4/7) / sqrt(98/49) = (-1/sqrt(98), -9/sqrt(98), 4/sqrt(98))

u3 = a3 - (a3·e1)e1 - (a3·e2)e2 = (-1, 4, -3) - (-1/14)(3, 1, 2) - (10/98)(-1, -9, 4)
= (-1/2, 17/2, -5/2)
e3 = u3 / ||u3|| = (-1/2, 17/2, -5/2) / sqrt(155/4) = (-1/sqrt(155), 17/sqrt(155), -5/sqrt(155))

2. Form the orthogonal matrix Q and upper triangular matrix R:

Q = |  3/sqrt(14)  -1/sqrt(98)  -1/sqrt(155) |
    |  1/sqrt(14)  -9/sqrt(98)  17/sqrt(155) |
    |  2/sqrt(14)   4/sqrt(98)  -5/sqrt(155) |

R = | sqrt(14)  8/sqrt(14)  -1/sqrt(14) |
    |    0      sqrt(98/7)  10/sqrt(98) |
    |    0         0        sqrt(155/4) |

3. Solve the system Rx = Q^Tb:

Q^T = |  3/sqrt(14)   1/sqrt(14)   2/sqrt(14) |
      | -1/sqrt(98)  -9/sqrt(98)   4/sqrt(98) |
      | -1/sqrt(155) 17/sqrt(155) -5/sqrt(155) |

Q^Tb = |  3/sqrt(14)   1/sqrt(14)   2/sqrt(14) | |  1  |
        | -1/sqrt(98)  -9/sqrt(98)   4/sqrt(98) | | -7  |
        | -1/sqrt(155) 17/sqrt(155) -5/sqrt(155) | |  4  |

Q^Tb = | 11/sqrt(14) |
        | -19/sqrt(98) |
        |  51/sqrt(155) |

Now, we can solve the system Rx = Q^Tb using back-substitution:

z = (51/sqrt(155)) / (sqrt(155/4)) = 2
y = (-19/sqrt(98) - 10 * z) / (sqrt(98/7)) = -1
x = (11/sqrt(14) - 8 * y - z) / sqrt(14) = 1

So, the solution to the system of linear equations is x = 1, y = -1, and z = 2.
